thread.title: Couldn't Help But Notice: Auburn running backs could have big days against San Jose State (podcast) | AL.com
thread.title_full: Couldn't Help But Notice: Auburn running backs could have big days against San Jose State (podcast) | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Couldn't Help But Notice: Auburn running backs could have big days against San Jose State (podcast) | AL.com
text:
Auburn is recommitting to its running game, led by Peyton Barber and his three 100-yard performances this season.
The Tigers (2-2, 0-2 SEC) are struggling on offense, especially on first down , but with three-touchdown underdog San Jose State coming back to the Plains, the Auburn running game should be able to find success.
SJSU (2-2, 1-1 MW) ranks 117th in the FBS against the run, so Auburn could have a big day on the ground, possibly with multiple players topping the 100-yard plateau.
Defensively, we'll know quickly whether the limiting of Mississippi State to 1 for 8 on third downs in the second half last week was an indication of turning a corner or if Auburn still has to find answers.
RELATED: 5 burning questions, prediction with SJSU writer
SJSU's Tyler Ervin is coming off a national best 300-yard game against Fresno State. He'll pose a legitimate challenge to an Aubrun defense that's also been poor against the run.
You can listen to the show in the player below or at WarEagleSportsRadio.com . The show is also available on demand via the War Eagle Sports Radio app on iOS or Android .
Look for future editions of Couldn't Help But Notice on Mondays and Fridays.
